New York City faces significant challenges as a nor’easter threatens Halloween festivities with heavy rain and strong winds, while panic buttons return to schools amid safety concerns, and residents report discolored tap water, raising health questions.

### Risks & Alerts

- Nor’easter expected to bring heavy rain and 50 mph winds to NYC; potential impact on Halloween plans. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- NYC warns of increased traffic crashes as Daylight Saving Time ends and sun sets earlier. [↗](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMiqAFBVV95cUxQdnJtZTgwREE0UnFhUWpNd19GOE1NNGlNcTNma0xaTUlfZWpyalVFZVFxTENqRUdORjRvYS1nSWlNcEE3NlRmNHVYUUMxSU1WMHpIY1FKTVg5aGRHRDZnQWVxd1RuVERfcFNhTlBkcjRobFB1cTJJSFljOGJySXg4MExkcGhvMmZZdXF3YlhWdzVrTVBYYUJzSjgwSExUblhQVm9BLThPdUs?oc=5)
- New Yorkers reporting discolored tap water; safety of drinking it is under investigation. [↗](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMiswFBVV95cUxOZ3JwUmduRERMaVNRcU1LVVBtVFd2bmxJRlhJdDViZFFNMnBQaklzNHNQek1TNV9wQjNlTFBsTjB3Nm1rUW5yNFk1ZnNHcWhuaWFXb25wNXpQMjdJZDJ3a3JTdkRWVjA0T3kwWHlxSWFiTGpNT1FoQktwWlRFSFozLWU0aXpRS25ZYlBQX0RzdG0tY0tjR3ppOTNjT0F4RHhDN2p4eGhQSXdVM0o2YmZ0bXpyOA?oc=5)
- Panic buttons are returning to NYC schools following a previous pilot linked to an FBI investigation. [↗](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMiswFBVV95cUxPek14NzZhT3F1MDNfUTBSOXpkaFczWWpaRWViUGsxT2owZmVFd3dlVG8tanlGeEp3QjdweUdZd2sxb24yTWlSRkVNdUI1Q2l6aldRaTNzeTJ6M2tEZ0d4T1dIY0R1XzJoRnNvcnlQSXllVWZjdW9tMXFkenpQOTVtS01hSzFmeHRidzR6aDhyN3RBcmY3SzZ2bFZhemNPcXc3QzZNdmVnOWxEejlXRWt0X0ZkTQ?oc=5)
